ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: SO MANY. I learned so much and discovered a passion for Ochem I never thought I would have.
It's a very cool class and I liked it better than the intro chem sequences
a lot about organic chemistry.

I gained a great understanding of first-term organic chemistry, and feel as though I got a really thorough understanding as to how and why different organic processes occur. I became a lot better at understanding the various ways different molecules interact with one another and the ways in which knowledge of organic chemistry can be useful/apply to various biomedical processes. Feel like I have a good base moving into Orgo II and MCAT prep,
I learned about the basic organic chemical processes and got abetted understanding of chemical reactions.
This course provided a general knowledge of organic chemistry.
Intro organic chemistry (reactions, conformations, etc)
In this course, I learned many of the essential reaction mechanism for organic chemistry and I was able to synthesize molecules using these mechanism.
Learned about organic chemistry.
I learned about the basics of organic chemistry
I learned quite a lot about organic chemistry concepts and reactions, also to not rely on memorization but to also gain an intuition into how compounds would react with each other.
honestly enjoyed it a lot. had a lot of fun learning how to solve the puzzles of reaction mechanisms

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of the course are the teaching. The weaknesses are probably that TAs grade everything and he doesn't hand out many practice problems.

strengths: great TAs weaknesses: third midterm was basically a final because it was all cumulative but overall I think less work than I was anticipating. Spiegel was a really fun professor and I actually enjoyed being in class but if you didn't go to class there were no lecture slides or supplementary material. I also really liked how the course was only 2 days a week instead of 3

Strengths were the PSETs. they were hard, but they represented the exams very well, so i never felt surprised. Also the professor was fun and entertaining. Never felt like falling asleep during this class. Also, the TFs and peer tutors were of great help.

Strengths: David Spiegel is an old-school, thorough lecturer, and his style of teaching was amazing. I really appreciate that he didn't teach explicitly from the textbook or using PowerPoints, instead moving stepwise through the chemistry on the blackboard. It was clear he knew how to teach organic chemistry clearly, and I felt as though the pace of the class was really good. I never felt behind or ahead and was well-prepared for each lecture's material on the basis of previous lectures. It was a terrific class in the sense that it knew exactly what it was trying to do... I went into organic chemistry praying I'd be able to pass and came out absolutely loving the subject. Nothing about the class micromanages student learning p-sets were short, but each question had relevance to the material/exams; and the midterms themselves were always fair. Workload was exceedingly manageable; I wish all my STEM classes at Yale were like this one. If you showed up and engaged with the material I think it would be hard to have a bad experience. I also enjoyed the longer MW lectures as opposed to the gen chem MWF lectures; it gave me the weekend to prep for MW content. 

Weaknesses: I thought section could have a little more structure/talking points; they were open-ended for questions but sometimes I wasn't entirely sure as to what questions I should be asking. It would be nice to have a few more practice problems available before the exam (i.e. longer Exam Review sheets).
The course was a bit confusing and sometimes all over the place, but I really preferred the lectures taking place twice a week instead of 3 times.
The strengths are a great teaching team, small class, very useful sections, great peer tutors, and honestly prof spiegel is a pretty engaging lecturer because its pretty funny.
Peer tutoring and TAs were very very helpful
Prof. Spiegel is nice and helpful. I wish the lecture notes were posted

I think the lectures were nicely structured. The problem sets were also helpful to learning. I did find myself in some classes lost by the end of the amount of mechanisms explained in a single lecture, but it was not often. Also, the two-day set up instead of three times a week felt much better and allowed me to be more involved in lectures. I would not have liked the course as much with the three-day structure that general chemistry has.

Strengths: content was good. Classes were only on Monday Wednesday which was fantastic. The TAs were amazing
Weakness: couldnt miss class as the content was entirely written on the chalkboard.
Weaknesses: I would have preferred more examples in lecture. Strengths: spiegel is great!
off sequence was great because smaller class, better vibes, closer with TAs/prof. having only Monday/Wednesday classes and no Friday classes was amazing!!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you can take it with Prof. Spiegel, absolutely. He is such an engaging lecturer and really cares about his students.
Yes, if you have to take orgo.

Yes, for sure. I came into orgo terrified and under the impression that it would take a Herculean effort to merely pass. Orgo definitely gets a bad rap  put in the time on your own to cement the ideas and the "whys" behind different concepts, and it is hugely fun and satisfying. I feel this class prepared me well for both Biochem and the MCAT to the point where I'm debating whether I should change my major to chemistry. Even if you had a bad experience/didn't enjoy Gen Chem, I think orgo (at least with Spiegel!!!) is a course everyone should take at Yale.
Only if you are very interested in Organic Chemistry or need to take it for your major.
Yes take it off sequence if you can because the learning environment is more tight knit and collaborative
Yes, this is likely a prerequisite but the workload is reasonable.
I had a lot of fun in this course, and I would recommend it, but I do believe most of my enjoyment was because of Prof. Spiegel and my TA Leanna.
Yes, especially with dr dr Spiegel
Yes! Very interesting and fun course
Yes
if u need to take it, do it off sequence! or if u want a crazy science credit and like problem solving
